citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The indoor portion of the shared shelter building for the 2 grivets, and 3 ring-tailed lemurs have excessive feces, with a
strong ammonia odor.
Excreta and food waste must be removed from inside each indoor primary enclosure daily and from underneath them as
often as necessary to prevent an excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent the nonhuman primates
from becoming soiled, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors.
Clean the primary enclosures for the 2 grivets, and the 3 ring-tailed lemurs as often as necessary to prevent soiling of the
animals, disease hazards, and to reduce odors.

-There is an approximately 2' in diameter and 10" deep hole in the dirt floor of the singly housed female dromedary camel.
-The primary enclosure for the 3 African Crested porcupines has buried wire under the dirt substrate. The porcupines
have dug several areas approximately 4" below the wire.
-The shelter for the 4 llamas is missing a board at the bottom of the west end of the shelter.
-The shelter for the 3 Valais blacknose sheep housed together has small rusted holes on the left side.
The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor
and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals
from injury and to contain the animals.
Construct and maintain facilities to ensure animals are safely housed, and have appropriate shelter.

-The enclosure for the 2 cows, 4 sheep, and 5 goats has 4 shelter. All shelters have excessive feces and soiled straw.
-The shelter for the zebra has excessive feces, and soiled straw in it.
Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals
contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors.
Clean enclosures and shelters as often as necessary to minimize disease hazards, prevent soiling of the animals and
reduce odors.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Kira Wagner, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
